quoteFirst: [Footnote 1: This is not, I take it, one of the poet's irregular though not unmusical lines; the five short unemphatic syllables, rapidly run together in one slurring note of scorn, being not more than equivalent in metrical w
quoteLast: such as would take their places if the verse were thus altered--and impaired:
title: The Age of Shakespeare
author: Swinburne, Algernon Charles, 1837-1909

quoteFirst: Formerly nine o'clock was a more common hour for opening court. In New York in 1829 the sittings were from
quoteLast: , when there was a recess of two hours for dinner, and then from five till some time in the evening, occasionally as late as ten.[Footnote: Kennedy, "Memoirs of William Wirt," II, 231.
title: The American Judiciary
author: Baldwin, Simeon E. (Simeon Eben), 1840-1927

quoteLast: when the Arabs made their first rush, and it was just ten minutes past three when the enemy was finally repelled and the bugle sounded "Cease firing."  Yet into these pregnant eighteen minutes all that we have described, and a vast deal more, was crowded.
title: Blue Lights: Hot Work in the Soudan
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael), 1825-1894

quoteFirst: Mégnin adds that it is always advisable to disinfect the soil of preserves. For this purpose, the best means of destroying any eggs or embryos it may contain is to water the ground with a solution of sulphuric acid, in the proportion of a pennyw
quoteLast: pints of water, and also birds that die of the disease should be deeply buried in lime.
title: Scientific American Supplement, No. 460, October 25, 1884
author: Various

quoteFirst: It is marvellous to see a skilled man building such a wall. The stones are of all shapes and sizes, from half a hundredw
quoteLast: or four, just as the rock or boulder happens to split up; and there may be many dozens of them lying about. He glances round and selects a stone, perhaps fifty feet away, and has it brought to him; and it fits in exactly with the stones he has just used, or only needs a single blow to knock off some protuberance.
title: Small Talk at Wreyland. Third Series
author: Torr, Cecil, 1857-1928

quoteFirst: In every branch, from the most solid to the most sentimental, she was victorious. For machinery a million of gamins beat a million of Cockneys in the proportion of seven to six; in the economical and chemical arts, four to one; in the geographical and geometrical,
quoteLast: ; and in the fine arts, Waterloo was reversed to the tune of twenty to four.
title: Lippincott's Magazine of Popular Literature and Science, Volume 17, No. 099, March, 1876
author: Various
